common.title: CC Name - Name Recommendation System Based on Chinese Culture
common.description: A name recommendation system based on ancient Chinese poetry, classics, and principles of Wu Xing and Yi Jing
common.path_not_exists: The path you are trying to access does not exist
common.page_moved: This page may have been moved or deleted

home.description: Combining the essence of traditional culture from 'Shijing' and 'Four Books and Five Classics' with the profound wisdom of Wu Xing and Yi Jing to create a unique name chart for you.
home.wuxing_desc: Based on your date and time of birth, precisely matching the Five Elements attributes to ensure your name harmonizes with your destiny
home.shijing_desc: Drawing inspiration from the Book of Odes, incorporating classical culture to infuse your name with deep cultural meaning
home.wuxing_tooltip: The Five Elements (Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth) are an important theory in ancient Chinese philosophy that explains the composition of the natural world and its laws of movement and change. This theory holds that everything in the world is composed of the Five Elements, which mutually promote and restrain each other: Wood promotes Fire, Fire promotes Earth, Earth promotes Metal, Metal promotes Water, and Water promotes Wood. In naming, the principle of mutual promotion and restraint of the Five Elements can help balance one's destiny and bring good fortune while avoiding misfortune.
home.shijing_tooltip: The 'Shijing' (Book of Odes) is the oldest collection of poetry in China, containing 311 poems from the early Western Zhou Dynasty to the middle of the Spring and Autumn Period (11th to 6th centuries BCE). It contains rich cultural connotations, beautiful imagery, and profound human spirit. In naming, drawing inspiration from the allusions and imagery in the 'Shijing' not only gives names a far-reaching cultural foundation but also continues the essence of Chinese culture.

intro.p1: We are a team dedicated to the inheritance of traditional Chinese culture, focused on providing cultural heritage name recommendation services.
intro.p2: Combining traditional naming principles and modern data analysis, we offer unique and meaningful name options for every family.

team.title: Professional Team
team.description: A professional team with years of naming experience, deeply versed in the essence of traditional culture

method.title: Scientific Method
method.description: Combining traditional culture with modern analytical methods to provide you with the best recommendations

contact.intro: If you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to contact us

surname.title: Chinese Surname Culture
surname.subtitle: Explore five thousand years of surname origins, inherit the imprint of Chinese civilization

banner.alt: History of the Hundred Family Names

origin.title: Origin and Evolution of Surnames
origin.description: Chinese surname culture has a long history dating back to antiquity. Initially, there was a distinction between 'xing' (姓) and 'shi' (氏): 'xing' represented blood relations, while 'shi' indicated social status or territorial division.

distribution.title: Hundred Family Names and Regional Distribution
distribution.ranking_desc: The most common surnames in China currently are Li, Wang, Zhang, Liu, Chen, etc. The distribution and migration of these surnames reflect population movement and cultural integration throughout Chinese history.
distribution.regional_desc: Common surnames in southern regions differ from those in the north, which is closely related to historical migration waves, geographical environment, and cultural traditions.
